Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes. Correct again. We have all seen this too many times before. ICO ends, projects throw their token up on the exchanges and forget about it. Luckily, we are not followers. We have learned from the many mistakes other projects make.  So.... How about another update? I don't want to jinx anything here but so far every large prospective partner or advisor that I've had my sights set on has eventually joined our team and/or closed an important deal with us. So, it's good to put these things out in the open. Makes me work harder towards the goal. I have been talking with the Pigzbe CEO. Nothing specific has been discussed yet but he mentioned the words "exploring a partnership or merger". If you don't know Pigzbe then I suggest looking them up. They are our European counterpart. A bit more funded and operating in a way more flexible region in terms of banking and finance. I like their work ethic and they are very professional. I see them not as competition, but as powerful allies. I pitched "Trading Wheels" to them too. This part of the process is painstakingly slow but we are marching forward still. Nothing will prevent our success. Count on that!

Author: lobat999
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: It seems that this project is on the right path to success especially if you've done deals with a strategic partners likes Pigzbe and I think it will absolutely empower and mutually compliment both projects. I had very high hopes on this one too! Great job!

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thanks for that. I admit that this past two months I have been posting less. I apologize for that. Since January of this year I have tried my hardest to show up and answer as many questions as possible..... That being said, there were several times where I was absent for two or more weeks and expected to come back to FUD filled comments and accusations. However, EVERY single time I instead returned to see that this community stepped up to the plate and answered every question in my absence exactly the way I would've(maybe less wordy though). For this, I am ultimately grateful. The fact that you guys care enough to help out others that come here with questions is awesome but on top of that, it seems everyone here in this thread knows enough about the URAllowance project and our progress to accurately do this makes me know that we are doing something right. I have said this before and I will say it again. You are all just as important to this project as I am. Without you, there is no URAllowance. Thank You.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Whoa! Don't get the wrong idea.... lol. We have not completed or signed or done anything Strategic yet with Pigzbe other than have a few chats via LinkedIn PM and through emails. Nothing has even been discussed in detail yet. In fact, I have not received a response in three days. I will follow up with the CEO tonight and I will keep you updated. I just wanted to make it very clear that all we have done so far is acknowledge each other's awesomeness and had a few back and forths. I will be pursuing this strategic partnership. I would be crazy not to. Pigzbe would also be crazy to not see the value URAllowance brings to the table. Our community alone(you guys) is priceless. This is one of the very few unshilled projects in existence. One year and 48 pages is perfect in my opinion. Imagine trying to find some specific comment mixed in to a 1009 page 2 month old project thread. lol. That cracks me up.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Well, actually.... I've been in back to back meetings trying to find a service or solution to the scenario where our platform users could have a sufficient amount of options to spend their URA on. We are not delusional to think that that more than 1/1000 kids will actually want to hold their crypto rather than spend it on real world items or even digital game bucks for Fortnite or Rocket League.  That has been a major concern of ours since January. Today, I finally found the answer. I didn't find it, actually. One of our most trusted advisors and very good friend of mine introduced me to the opportunity and I couldn't be more pleased with the conversations I've had so far with this company.  If this works out, we will have no problem retaining our user base and they will be able to spend their tokens just about anywhere in the world. I am not too sure how they feel about me disclosing their name just yet. But the second I get the green light from them, I will blast it here.  I can give you a hint though. They are a branch of an established and very successful financial remittances company that jumped into the crypto space last year. They had a successful ICO in Nov. 2017 and since then they have been meeting their road map goals and have been in full development mode. They are also a card processor.  That's all I will say till tomorrow or the next day.  Still no word from Pigzbe. They are busy setting up their Kickstarter campaign so I understand that we are an afterthought. We are busy too and I haven't even had time to send that follow up email. I should be doing that now actually.... Bye.  P.S. I am not against anyone from this community jumping over to the Pigzbe thread and reminding them how awesome this community and project is and we should partner up.

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yep. This is one of the most exciting partnerships that we have in the works right now. Nothing is signed so I'm not counting my chickens. But I can tell all parties to  this deal are excited as well.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Scratch that Paycent partnership..... Or better yet, put it on the back burner. We came to terms but this partnership is now contingent on us being listed on Coinmarketcap. This is perfectly understandable and we intend to pursue this at a later date. For now, we continue to focus on development and tallying up the bounties.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: That's the way we see it too. Actually, I was thinking that it was a bit premature on their part and if they would've followed through I might have the one to put the brakes on. It's good to focus on what's in front of you. We are constantly building our network and the opportunities that were just over the horizon are now just out of reach. We are making progress every single day. I would like to have been finished with beta testing by now but that would have resulted in a sub par experience for our users. Thank you all for understanding and not being too hard on me when things don't go according to plan.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Not really for homework necessarily. More for participating in extracurricular activities and fundraisers. One thing we are trying to work out is a system with our partners at EventChain to where school events or anything that includes the sale of tickets could be implemented through EventChain's platform and the kids could be rewarded for contributing to ticket sales or event organizing. This is still very much in the concept phase and I haven't even received an official confirmation from EventChain that they are onboard with the idea. Once the URAllowance platform is released, we will be able to more easily integrate new ideas and initiatives into it. It seems like a no-brainer to me. It's a Win Win Win scenario with minimal risk for all sides.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Quote from: lvsca on October 20, 2018, 05:57:00 PM IMPORTANT NEWS  Announcement! Our App will be ready for testing on November 15th, 2018.  keep in touch with us   Ha! I just came here to make this announcement and low and behold, The URAllowance team is two steps ahead of me. Thanks guys. I'm going to publish the details for the Beta Testers and Early Adopters Program in a few minutes.  I also would like to say that the last 4 times I stopped in to give an update, I was worried about how long it had been since the last one. So, expecting to have to answer two pages of questions before I could post the updates, I was pleasantly surprised to see that several members from our community had already already answered every question accurately and in detail. I've said it before and I will say it a hundred more times...... This is the very best, and from what I've seen, the only truly organic, 100% shill-free community out of all the projects that I've seen over the years in this forum.  Personally, I would like to see a little more FUD so I can sharpen my troll slaying skills. I'm not complaining though.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes! HoshoCon! It was awesome! We had a blast and learned so much. However, we realized on day one that HoshoCon was not an event held for ICO Promotion or Investor Relations. That is ok with us though. I would like to give a shoutout to Hartej Sawhney for looking out for the local Las Vegas Blockchain companies and giving the URAllowance team complimentary VIP passes and some cool gifts too. Hartej is a solid dude and an "old-schooler" that cares about blockchain and the communities cyber-safety. So we didn't do very much ICO promoting while we were there. We left a little bit smarter though.  Next on the Agenda is...CoinAgenda!!! Otherwise known as the Investor's Summit. This will be the opportunity to promote not only URAllowance but our partners from around the world too. The IMMO.Foundation, Ammeris Foundation, Share Internet Data(SID), BitWhite(BTW) and EventChain(EVC). Ashton Addison, the CEO of EventChain.io has provided us with these complimentary passes to CoinAgenda. Being the media mogul that he is, he of course, hooked us up with press passes. Thanks Ashton Addison, to you and your communication staff. You are all very professional.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Biggest Update Ever! Let me begin by saying.... Did you guys miss me? This was the longest I was away without any updates. I have plenty of good explanations for my absence but why waste time with all that? Instead I will deliver some great news about our progress and new partners and upcoming events and more.... We have been very busy to say the least. To say the most......  We have decided to extend the sale for a minimum of two months but definitely no longer than December. I said from the beginning that the end date was set only to please the form fields of the rating sites and that we most likely will push the date forward. There are many opportunities that we can't miss in the next two months. I could ramble on in full detail but to make this much less painful for anyone that is in a hurry, I will make a long list of all the updates that have happened over the past few weeks and the things to come that we are very excited about.......We are an accepted form of payment for buying Share Internet Data tokens.   New Partners: 1.) ShareInternetData.io Here is a video in which SID’s Chairman explains why the URAllowance (URA) partnership is mutually beneficial. https://youtu.be/I1x6xp6XRx8 By the way SID Limited accepts the URA Token as payment method for the purchase of the SID Token (SIDT). Click here to purchase SID Tokens with your URA tokens: www.ShareInternetData.io. If you don't have URA yet www.URAllowance.com   We have many plans with the SID and URA platforms working together to incentivize users and cross promote in a way that joins our platforms together. This partnership doesn't end with SID.  2.) www.Ammeris.com Here is an article that went out to 1,000s of news sites and family magazines across the world. https://www.ammeris.com/announcement/ammeris-urallowance-form-partnership-to-bring-blockchain-and-smart-contracts-to-family-homes A quote from yours truly.... “The strategic partnership with Ammeris is a perfect fit. Ammeris understands that evolving is the key to not only survive, but to thrive in the fastest changing industry in history. URAllowance and the team that drives it lives by this principle, albeit at a smaller level focusing in on the evolution of families. The Ammeris and URAllowance partnership will work together to introduce an advanced level of technology along with a more responsible consumption of energy into the family unit. This is progress at its finest. The advantages of joining forces with Ammeris are magnified by both of our team's relentless pursuit of innovative societal improvements.” ~CB  Ammeris founder said..... “I have been talking to Chris for several months about his project and have been impressed by the passion and energy emanating from his team. The team and I at Ammeris believe URA’s project is an obvious fit for collaboration as there is no better way to get adoption and to educate our societies about DLT than by bringing cryptocurrencies and smart contacts into the lives of young people. We look forward to working with URA to assist in their rollout of their application throughout countless households.” ~ Paul Mears  3.) IMMO High1000. (ask for a link in PM if you're curious) I am proud to announce that I was among the first to be recruited into the High1000. This is an organization that understands macroeconomics better than any company out there that is also pushing for adoption of blockchain and cryptocurrency.    IMMO is one of our strongest partners and we are glad to have each other's best interest in mind. Contact me directly for any info regarding IMMO.  Events:(Don't worry, we wouldn't dare spend even one Satoshi of contributor's coins on admission. We are highly against using project money to attend these things)  All events I have managed to call in favors and pull some strings and get passes into all of them for free. We have already attended ChainExchange and Blockshow. We did not have any overpriced booths. We were able to meet great people and spread the word of URAllowance to many people. Our next to shows that we will be attending, we are so excited about. These are the two best shows of this entire year by a long shot.  HoshoCon @ The Hard Rock Hotel: https://www.hoshocon.com/ I just received my confirmation today. Passes for the whole team and I even got two for future partners(to be announced)  Once again.... We have not and will not pay for any events. I know of some companies that ran out of money because they attended too many of these things. I have enough clout in this space that I should be able to get into any that fit our purpose and schedule for free.  CoinAgenda @ The Mandalay Bay: https://coinagenda.com/ The blockchain investors conference. Compliments of our strategic partner Ashton Addison, CEO of EventChain.io  We are aiming to get into World Crypto Con at the Aria too. I will update on that venture soon.  Aside from that there are many other things we are working on but I wanted this update to be only the events and partnerships that are 100% guaranteed. I have even more exciting things in the works. Fingers crossed on those.

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I didn't mean borders from a political or even a geographical viewpoint. What I meant by disappearing borders at the social level, I meant that people are becoming more internationally connected. Largely because of blockchain and crypto I think. Also because of social media, streaming, and online gaming. Cultures will start to mesh together at a faster rate than before. When I was a kid, pop-culture would take years to travel between countries. In the 90's in America, where much of the pop-culture originates, it was like going back in time twenty years when you went to Mexico and about 5 years in Canada. Now, fads travel as fast as information. How many countries were playing with fidget spinners last year? Most of them. How many continents are being Rekd by kids playing Fortnight this very moment? Most of them. So if bad habits are spreading in one country, they will surely spread to the rest of the world as fast as a Fortnight update.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes! Exactly. You understand the very essence of URAllowance and why we are doing this. It's not just about teaching kids responsibility. It's much more than that. When I was a kid, I was very respectful and fearful of adults. I believed for many years that all adults were infallible. It wasn't until my teenage years that I discovered parents and adults were also f**k ups at times. Excuse my language, but there is no putting it lightly here. I am a parent and I am not perfect. There are sooooo many things that I could've done better. My boy is 11 years old. I have at least 7 more years of mistakes to make. I wasn't taught how to properly manage my finances. Many other parents that I meet are in the same situation. I had to learn the hard way. I spent the first several years of adulthood being reminded to pay my power bill when all my appliances and lights would suddenly go out. I'm 35 now and I am confident in my ability to manage my finances. But what about our users and members of our community that have children but were not taught how to manage their finances responsibly? How are they supposed to teach their children these fundamental skills if they do not even know how themselves? The answer is simple.... Learn with them. Sometimes the best way to learn something is to teach it. URAllowance is for parents and kids. It won't be long before our kids are teaching us how to be better.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Hello everyone. Sorry for my extended absence. I had some personal issues involving a tragedy in my family. I am back now and everything is going great. Over the past 1.5 weeks since I've reported to the community I have met some amazing, influential people that have pledged to help bring the URAllowance initiative into the mainstream. Thanks to our partner David Drake, we had a powerhouse meeting with some of the smartest people I've ever met in this industry. We met with Reginald Ringgold of Blockvest and is considered one of the top crypto minds furthering blockchain into worldwide acceptance, Eric Anderson of Rockstar Games and Demon Saw and Promether. My personal friend and business partner Yogesh of CryptoXpress, Mike Sheppard of Blockvest Exchange and of course Mike Martin, President of URAllowance. This all happened when we took over the halls of the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino during the ChainXchange conference here in Las Vegas. The things that were discussed during this meeting were so inspirational that I have no doubt in my mind that we are on the right path. Success at this point is imminent.  To answer the question I quoted here. no we don't have the funds in our possession. They are locked safely in escrow and will be released shortly. Traditional money, traditional rules. We have to respect his way of doing business. The good thing is is it's not an investor its a contributor that is buying tokens and no equity is being taken. Furthermore, this deal, although private is creating a domino effect as we were contacted by another private buyer that wants to negotiate a bonus percentage. As hard as it is for me to do private sales and not reveal the buyer, I have to also respect their privacy. However, it is written in the contract that I will reveal the details of the sale including the amounts purchased and the bonuses provided. That was our non negotiable clause. We vowed to keep our community up to date and we will not agree to any deals that require us to give a larger bonus than the community is aware of. So far, 40% bonus is the highest we've offered. 35% is the highest we've actually provided. The terms changed and the offered 40% was lowered. That good news because that means more tokens for you guys.  Once again, please accept my apologies for my short leave. It was unavoidable. I'm back now and I can't wait to share more with you as there are many events planned in the near future.

I have access to the Midex devs. Part of my duties at MIDEX include forming partnerships and spreading the usage of MIDEX across the globe. We could simply put a link to MIDEX with instructions on how to use all their new fiat/crypto systems. Or we could go a step further and integrate a gateway that runs from inside our platform. You all have helped us to brainstorm through some pretty complicated issues. Over the last 8 months we have come up with some great ideas and traveled down unforseen paths because of suggestions, criticism and debate from the URAllowance community. Thank you Thank you. Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I thought the same exact thing , of course. Being active members in the crypto community we see the benefits of blockchain technology in anything it is applied to. For someone outside of the crypto community though..... Not so much. The above companies that we listed, the fiat only ones anyways, have a distinct advantage. They have the ability to be backed by a bank, apply a debit card that is also backed by a bank and they can be insured to handle the transmission of money to and from their customers accounts. With blockchain and crypto, those luxuries go away. For now anyways. Soon enough there will be enough blockchain companies in our country that the legislators will realize that they must make room for us and blow away the cloud of uncertainty that they clutch onto so tightly. We think the addition of fiat and debit cards into our platform would be the best possible way to sustain the highest possible user base while also bringing in non-crypto users and making them more comfortable with using crypto and to understand blockchain a little bit better. You are right about us being in it for the long term..... We wouldn't have locked our core team's tokens in a time capsule for 3 years if we weren't

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I have learned at least one thing from those annoying business gurus that tell everyone how to get rich and be successful. It is that if you aren't making mistakes and failing things on a regular basis, you aren't trying new things or taking any risks. To fail is to learn. If you have the right mindset anyways. People rarely evaluate themselves or their performance when they are winning all the time. Winning is easy. Winning is comfortable. To be able to enter into a situation that is uncomfortable, strange, and new and difficult knowing you may fail is one of the bravest "Man vs. Himself" events you can face. I still fear these situations every time. I catch myself still making  excuses to not push forward too. The example we are trying to set with URAllowance has been a huge motivator in helping me defeat these fears. After all, how can I be a provider of a platform that is teaching kids how to be successful, responsible, and proud of their achievements if I don't lead by example? For example...... Very soon I will be appearing on a few different T.V. shows and podcasts and radio and......up on stage in front more people than I want to talk to at one time.    I am not a good public speaker and I am tripping over the whole thing. But, I will climb my A$$ up on to the stage and do what I gotta do to get past that fear. For a human to fear something that doesn't directly threaten our lives or the possibility of bodily harm is ridiculous.... I know this.... But here I am knowing it is true.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: The fiat gateway...... This has been the challenge of the century. To include fiat wallets, we become money transmitter and if any of the currencies are interchangeable and can be used on a secondary market, we would fall into the category of being an exchange. To be a money transmitter it requires licensing and then we would have to be backed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) or have a partner that is (Usually a Bank). There is an alternative to federal backing. We would theoretically need to have $250,000 in a trust fund for every single member that we handled fiat for. I'm not a banker so correct me if I'm wrong. I'm pretty sure this information is accurate though.  ANY IDEAS? We have had this as an open discussion since January. We could use some fresh ideas.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Definitely the parents will be there at first. But the reality of parenting and homework is that sometimes you have to leave the kids to their studies or practicing of their extra curricular activities. That's why we are going to include the multi-sig requirement. The kids will set up their trades and complete the required tasks set by their parents, guardians or teachers then they will sign the transaction first. The parents will then review the choices made by the kids and if they approve, they will be the second signature and the orders will be submitted. This solution creates a bit of problem that still needs to be solved too. The problem here is, the crypto markets are always moving. If a kid enters his choices and it takes the parents several hours to be able to check, or even days, the market conditions will have changed and the kids would not receive an accurate lesson on trading. I have a few ideas though. The one that makes the most sense is to have the platform send a push notification directly to the parents device. If the trade that the student has chosen changes by a specified amount the order is automatically cancelled. What do you think.  Oh yeah the name of this feature is "TRADING WHEELS". Pretty cool right?

Body: OMG! I'm 35 yrs. old. Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: 100% correct! We compiled tons of data through our research on this very topic. I have seen the speed in which my son adapts to and understands advanced tech. Watching him play on the XBox is a trip. He sets the sensitivity to the highest level and somehow can finesse his aim and control with precision. I set mine the same once........ Once. Just touching the control stick and my character's view spun in 12 full circles I couldn't even run in a straight line. And I'm a gamer! I beat Mike Tyson's Punch-out when I was 7 years old!!!! Regarding the average attention span of an a kid.... Here is how they used to calculate it.  "According to Kids Growth, the attention span of a child or teen who is actively trying to pay attention is 3 to 5 minutes for every year of the child's age. As a result, a 13-year-old has an attention span between 39 and 65 minutes, while a 16-year-old is capable of paying attention for 48 to 80 minutes."   That was back when I was a kid....... Today they say that the average attention span of a teenager is just 12 seconds!!!! While I don't fully agree with that statistic, mostly because they used time spent on webpages to extrapolate the data, but also because I have been around kids for many years. I would estimate it to be around two minutes. Which is the most watched length of tutorials and many other YouTube video genres. Times are changing. Evolution is happening. We should not resist it like a lot of our parents did and especially their parents did.  “It is not the strongest of the species that survives, not the most intelligent that survives. It is the one that is the most adaptable to change.” ~ Charles Darwin

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I've already spoken with 1 1/2 exchanges and two lawyers. This kids educational exchange is absolutely possible and legal. I even have a badass name for it..... Trading wheels. There are a few ways it could work. The first way is we build our own platform that is like a mirror to our partner or Trading Wheels accepting Exchange. It would be connected through API so that all the data is up do date. Any trades that happen on the Kids exchange would actually happen on the real exchange just as if the kid was there making the trade himself. The difference is..... The kids exchange is full of hover pop-ups with explanations and most importantly..... The Trading Wheels. Each trade submitted from the kids side would require two signatures. One from the kid. and the other from a parent, teacher, or guardian. This way the kids will never be able to trade blindly or without instruction. Once the parent, teacher, or guardian approves of the kids choice of trade he signs it and allows it to be sent to the order book. This is just a brief summary of a brainstorm session. There are many more details

Author: Rigorous
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Because many kids have ample time and patience to play around with such things, but for adults with a busy job any friction results in frustration and eventually abandonment. Crypto is currently too techy to appeal to a mass audience. Things like making sure you are not on a phishing site, unlocking your Ethereum wallet with your public address and private key which is encrypted with a passphrase you all need to keep secure, adding a custom token to MyEtherWallet by looking up its contract address and digits, then figuring out the gas amount based on the contract cost and network congestion... you see where this is going?

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Who promised a Super Bowl commercial? Regarding the NASDAQ appearance, I have only been told that it will happen. I haven't signed any documentation or bought any airplane tickets yet. I am sure Drake is a man of his word and this will happen. If it does, we will have a huge audience of people that only care about financial topics. It's the perfect venue for ICO marketing. Now, post ICO, when we are sold out of tokens and need to market the URAllowance platform, NASDAQ would do so well as a Super Bowl commercial. At this time we will shift our marketing focus from token sales to product marketing through YouTube top influencers. One influential YouTuber can do so much more than a 10 million dollar 30 second commercial. Maybe I'll get one of those guys that plays Fortnight all day and has 10 million subs to use URAllowance.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Haha. Yes. The little guy surprised me too when I asked him if he wanted to get involved by making some videos. It's actually kind of funny. I wanted the first video he made to be a candid representation of how misinformed kids are about crypto. My wife, Lori Brown, and I have worked in different sections of the crypto industry for years. It's been over two years since either one of us earned a paycheck in USD. So, with CryptoKid only knowing what he has overheard his mom and I talk about, I thought he would make a hilariously misinformed video to support my position that kids don't know anything, yet. When he showed me the video he made on his first take with no script. I was seriously so surprised and extremely proud at how much he has absorbed. Kids have an uncanny ability to learn. Their minds are not polluted with decades of experience and preconceived notions and cynicism. They have this potential that knows no limits. If you have kids and they appear to be naive to their surroundings and the conversations happening around them. Know that they are listening, absorbing, and learning every moment.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Attention URA community. We are still experiencing heavy congestion on the ETH blockchain. We spent ALL DAY yesterday trying to slip our contracts in and we had no luck. We went so far as to increase our GWEI so high that if it would've succeeded, it would,ve been a 1.5 ETH transaction. I don't like to spend frivolously so that was hard to watch. Mike and I actually made the call to hold off until it calmed down a bit. But, Larron, our CTO was already several hours into that world that only coders understand and basically refused to give up. He pulled 1.5 of his own ETH out of storage and sent the transaction through at 67 GWEI. After 25 minutes it timed out and only ended up costing him about 8 bucks worth of ETH...... Twice. We are not going to try again today. We will try again tomorrow though. Rather than stress out over the current situation, we decided to use this time to polish up the www.URAllowance.com website and also spend some time prepping our social media campaign.  Thank you all for your patience. This thread has turned into one of the best in all of the forum. I'm biased in my opinion but I also think it''s true. You have all very much become a part of this project and we will see this succeed far beyond what we ever imagined 7 months ago.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: OMG!!! I can't believe I didn't come straight here to tell you guys. This ETH blockchain thing had me all screwed up.Well here it is..... The AMAZING PARTNERSHIP NEWS!!!!  David Drake has become a managing member and equity holding partner to URAllowance, LLC! This is huge news. One, because he's super experienced in fintech and has a diverse network unlike no other. Two, he has agreed to blast URAllowance out to that network in the form Articles, Syndicated news, social media, and my favorite part..... TV appearances!!! On freaking NASDAQ and CNBC!!!! Sorry about my language but this is very exciting. Another awesome thing David brings to URAllowance with him is his friends in high place. The highest places. Ever hear of Family Offices? Well it's a relatively new term to me but I know now that it goes hand in hand with success. I couldn't possibly list all the things this partnership has to offer. Just yesterday he was in Zurich discussing banking options for us. Mike recently asked him if he could help us to achieve one of our impossible goals of finding a debit card solution for URA. As we all know, debit cards and crypto had a nasty falling out last year and there are only a few left operational. If we manage to find a solution to this problem that ends with us having URA debit cards, the rest will be history. So we would like to welcome David Drake officially to the URAllowance team roster. This will be a mutually beneficial partnership that will yield incredible results. I would also like to brag a little if I may. David Drake has been asked to take equity and become partner to 80+ projects. We are the first he has actually accepted. If that isn't a confidence booster, I don't know what is.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Hey everyone... Sorry I haven't been here today to answer any questions. I am 1.5 pages behind but rest assured that I will answer every single comment. As I always have.  Here is what we are dealing with. We scheduled our launch for yesterday. We were right on time with our preparations. Then I pulled a noob move and signed a basic "add owner address" transaction 16 times. This little reminder that crypto has a sense of humor only set us back about one hour as the redundant sigs confirmed one by one.  As of right now and since yesterday the ETH blockchain has been sooooo congested that we are still adding owners addresses for the multi-sig. We have a 3-signature requirement for any and all outgoing transactions. I will post an example of this congestion below. On one signature we are already 9 hours and 25 minutes pending. So needless to say that our token launch is being delayed for hopefully just a few more hours.  However, I realize that I said 06/30/2018 was going to be our launch date and we figured out a way to make that a reality. You can still log into our website and fill out your KYC requirements so that when our token is live you will automatically get your tokens within 30 minutes to a few hours.  I also have some incredible partnership/ownership news to share. Please stay tuned for that announcement later today. It is very exciting and set in stone.  Check this out.... 5:30AM PST/GMT-8 https://etherscan.io/tx/0x450003c2f71a1e54c98cc9a173303f588cbe9b09f87a8b5c48bdbc28a2163eaf ...Very funny Crypto... Very funny.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thank you. We are very fond of our digital 2-D team member, Due Dillinger.  Due Dillinger was an inside joke between our CEO, Michael Martin, and myself. I dawned Mike with the nickname several months ago because he is the master of due diligence and can get to the bottom of any team and their history and the most likely outcome of their project. One day he sends me this referral link to a project called Demicoin. I opened the site through his link and without question I sent 0.005 BTC for some Demicoin. Long story short this was the most obvious scam in the history of the world and I was probably the only person in the world that actually sent them anything. Lol. Shortly after the site went down and they disappeared. He never even went to the site himself. He did some phony airdrop or something and just sent me the link. I sent him a message that said something like "Bro, you were supposed to be Due Dillinger. How could you send me to a scam site?" He replied with, "Do your damned due diligence dummy. So you think I will still my credit for referring you?" That is how Due Dillinger was born.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: You know, I seriously considered that option. But the nature of crypto and our desire to "put it all out there" is the reason we chose not to self moderate. Because once admins start deleting comments, where is the line? Do they stop at spam? In most cases, it begins with SPAM, then moves onto deleting the fud comments. That kind of thread building is against our core values. Mostly because SPAM and FUD are objective terms and that kind of vagueness gives the admins too much power in being able to decide that any comment that doesn't make them look good is FUD and gets deleted. This is a HUGE problem in most telegram groups. Thats why we use a bot in our Telegram and the only comments that get deleted are the ones from members that post a link on their first day. Nothing else will be deleted. Our quality is our best weapon against FUD. Anyone that has tried say bad on us has ended looking foolish. lol.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I too would love for that to be the case but I'm sure it isn't. lol. At least for the majority anyways. You are right about the whales lurking and crawling the forum. I have talked already with the broker to one such whale that has been here for months and not posted one time.  I'm noticing that the spammiest of all the spam here has to something in common. EVERYTHING! lol. They all really love our logo though. Thank you Spammers. Because of your approval of our logo, anyone reading this thread will surely become supporters. I would love to read 50 more comments that say, "hey, nice logo. Your project makes me happy, I hope to success".

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: As of right now, everything is going according to plan. The 30th is coming fast but we are ready. I wanted to release the MVP at the same time as our launch. To avoid any more delays of our launch date. We will proceed without it and then we will release it immediately upon its completion within the first few weeks of the sale. We could put a rush on development but that never turns out a good product. I would've liked to have a more aggressive marketing campaign in place before launch as well but when your team is paying for their entire project from their own bank accounts, expensive marketing packages feel frivolous and irresponsible. Especially ICO marketing these days. None of the team, except CryptoKid, is new to crypto. We have all seen the steep increase in prices and fees for marketing an ICO. Lol. Because of our team's diverse experiences and long-standing relationships with many people in every corner of the crypto space, we all have very good connections and will have no problem getting the word out without having to pay 5 BTC for a banner and an article. Or 5 ETH per 5,000 fake Telegram members.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I hope so. I really like ETH. I think Vitalik is a genuinely good person too. Which makes me automatically want to support his efforts. If the Ethereum blockchain can perform as well as EOS has in the recent clips I've seen then that's even better. Not to say that EOS in any better than ETH. It does appear that way but the videos I have seen that show the speed of EOS compared to ETH never mention the fact that the EOS demonstration is running on a new blockchain that has doesn't have CryptoKitties and it's 30 copycat sites running on it on top of 98% of the gazillion different tokens. The Space Invaders EOS game was cool though. Every move on the D-pad and every action in the game was a flawless transaction on the blockchain. Free too.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thank you. We plan on it.  UPDATE: We are releasing our MVP soon. We don't have an exact date because you never know what kind of unforseen time killers will present themselves when building something new. I can tell you that the iOS version will be finished first. Followed shortly after by the Android and then the web version. Our aim is to have the iOS version downloadable and fully functioning within one week of the start of our sale. Which is scheduled for 06/30/2018. We will need testers from every region in the world so we can gather proper feedback and make any updates according to the feedback from our team of testers. More details will be released on the testing phase and also payment structures for our testing team. After all, we can't expect anyone to work for free. The testing team will be required to work a little more formally than if it were just a bounty. Our team of testers will be titled and will go on our website and whitepaper as official team members. So please stay tuned for that announcement.

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️

Author: Münzpräger
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Interesting times ahead. How does the current bear market affect your plannings if at all? Is postponing an option? I see many ICOs struggle simply because the hype of crypto has reduced by 90%.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: That is a great question and one that I have debated on in multiple threads for many projects other than our own. I think you know as well as I do that a bear market in crypto is just a bull in disguise. I have faith that even if we launched right now in the middle of "this terrible bearish market of doom" that we would be alright. Please reread the italicized and quoted sentence again with a heavy sarcastic tone and really draw out the end to express true sarcastic terror. NO, sir. We are not worried and as you can see we are not riding the hype of anything. I'll admit that riding the ICO wave to success was our initial goal. But that hype died right when we started this project. NO problem. We just have to work harder and show more value to the rightfully cautious community. Side note: If you zoom out on your crypto charts you can watch the bear transform into a steady bull run.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: The Meeting. It was good and there is definitely going to be a partnership with David Drake. We are now in the final negotiations and contract drafting phase. Basically, both parties, (URAllowance and Drake) have to list all of our expectations of this partnership. Then after we agree, we sign the legally binding contract, dance in a circle under the full moon and the partnership is formed. Our list of expectations is just about complete. Our legal advisor is looking it over then she will draw up the contract for us. I have a good feeling about this. Our first three phone conferences went very well and all of our personalities were very compatible. Meaning, there was no awkwardness or strongly opposing stances. Moving forward will be natural. In other news...... Here is the new architecture from the dev team. They are now programming our platform in full force under the guidance of Larron Armstead, our CTO. These guys are good. One of the most professional tech teams I've ever seen. With Larron at the helm, this is going to be a stellar, secure, user-friendly, work of art. Sorry about the long list of images. My tables are acting screwy.

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: This is a good question.  We briefly touch on the subject in our roadmap and WP. For now, the Ethereum blockchain will be just fine. But as we grow our user base we will probably need to move on to our own chain. But then again, Vitalik is taking about ETH updates and "sharding" and super fast transactions coming soon. I don't want to pretend to be a blockchain developer here, but it sounds kind of like the congestion issues with ETH may soon be a thing of the past. Personally, I want a blockchain just so I can say I have a blockchain. But if it is not absolutely necessary then why go through the hassle. A lot of people frown upon the tokens that are circulating and rightfully wonder..... "What the hell will this token ever be used for besides trading on an exchange?" URAllowance will be the token that is used the way it is meant to be used. Thanks for the question.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Oh yeah, the super important meeting that could've been the most important meeting in all of crypto..... How could I have forgotten... lol. I was just making sure you guys were paying attention. Well, long story short, it went better than I could've ever hoped for. Actually, let's go with a short story long..... The meeting started out with about twenty minutes of banter and chitchat about all kinds of topics. Then once we started in on the Q&A, Drake shooting the Qs while we were giving the As. Being the first time I spoke to David with our actual voices on a phone call rather than a chat platform, I didn't know what to expect. People are very different when your entire relationship has been over the internet with emails and chat apps. I'm no different. When I have a thesaurus and backspace ability, I can seem like I have mastered communication and might be super intelligent..... In person and on the phone, I am stripped of my superpowers and if caught off guard, become a stuttering, bumbling fool. Ok, digression over, back to the meeting..... Nothing is set in stone but we talked for about 45 minutes about several levels of cooperation before we both had to attend to our busy schedules. We picked up the conversation again the very next morning and we spoke for another 45 minutes. We ended the second call with an exchange of documents regarding the ways we decided we could be most beneficial to each other. We decided that becoming partners is a slam dunk opportunity for us both. We have another meeting scheduled for May 27th at 4:30 pm NY time and we will undoubtedly finalize the terms of our collaboration/partnership. When this happens, he will be bringing with him a strategic partnership with us that is too good to be true. I will not name it until it is either set in stone or a confirmed failure. Either way, I will be sharing the results. If I don't say anything by Monday the 28th of May then put me on blast again. lol Thanks for reading this. If you have in fact read this, I appreciate and respect your attention span.  ~CB

Sorry for the first two failed attempts. Our managers had nothing to do with the structuring of the first two bounty disasters. That was all me. I would like to say that "MattLeBlanc" and "lvsca" are two of the most capable and hardworking bounty/community managers I have ever met. If anyone reading this is tired of the more popular, although highly suspicious managers here in this forum, I suggest sending MattLeBlanc and lvsca a PM so you can book a spot on their calendars. After seeing how well they are performing here, they are sure to become very busy in the near future. Get them while you can. You will regret it if you don't.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Hello, thanks for your outlook. I'd like to invite you to check out our whitepaper and follow some of our sites sources to see that there is a huge market for this. Not only for families but for anyone who understands that money and greed are being phased out and are being replaced by value and transparency. This is why we are having a meeting tomorrow 5/14/2018 with a branding expert who may become our project manager and two acquaintances of our CTO from silicon valley to discuss a possible rebranding. The reason this discussion is on the table is because of the first impression people have been getting, exactly the opinion you expressed in your comment. We are creating something here that will be beneficial to so many people. The hardest part so far is getting people to look beyond a logo or read past a header. Everyone is so busy and the average attention span is dwindling down to nothing. We are in the right path, and beleive me when I say, comments like yours are taken very seriously and whenever there is common conception we have taken It into account and adjusted accordingly. Those of you that have been with us from the beginning already know this, but I'll say it again in case you are just getting here. We have been building or project under the scrutiny of the public and this community since before we had written Our first line of our whitepaper. Which was also written as a live document viewable by all from the very first line. All our progress has happened in plain sight. We have never pretended to be more than we are and we have grown faster and acheived more in a short period of time than we ever could've imagined. All our experiences so far have been shared as well, the good ones and the bad ones. When I make mistakes you probably heard about it from me first. All comments and suggestions from the community are taken seriously. We aren't just saying that like most companies. We are not just here to advertise and use the forum as a means to an end. This is our community too. Thank you.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thank you all for your continued support and kind words. Yes, I agree that communication with our community is of the utmost importance. We do have a community manager that is directly involved with our project. I knew him before this and I work with him on another project. We are both Regional Officers for the MIDEX Exchange. My territory is the US, his territory is Indonesia. Perhaps community manager is kind of a blanket term. lvsca does more than a community manager's typical scope of work. We are lucky to have him. lvsca, sorry for taking over your thread...lol. More CEOs and Presidents and Admins and people that are running these projects should get more involved with the community. They know enough to know that they need to post their ANN threads here. They just don't realize that this is not an advertisement channel. This is BitcoinTalk Forum. We are here to discuss all things cryptocurrency. I was working on a RunCPA integration for an ICO the other day and in the conversation with the CEO of a company I won't name, I mentioned Satoshi. Referring to the small amounts of Bitcoin. He said,  "What's a Satoshi?" I said, "Are you kidding? Not only is Satoshi the way we break down Bitcoin into amounts to the right of the decimal... Satoshi Nakamoto is the reason we are having this conversation. You need to know this or you are doomed to fail in this community." Thanks again. I will have some significant, game-changing updates in the next day or two. Please stay tuned for these as they could be the biggest announcements we've made to date.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: To answer the questions on this page...  Pre-sale and Sale Dates: Due to the fact that we have pushed back our start date 3 times, I'm reluctant to say. I will tell you that we have been aiming for a May 31st pre-sale start date. There are regulatory decisions we must make first. These decisions have been the hardest for us. We are a US based company and the only compliant way to conduct an ICO that involves US citizens being able to but tokens is to follow BS security laws that don't actually apply, yet. Which means we need to file for Reg A+. This cost is huge and out of our budget. We have not borrowed or collected any seed money. We are 100% self-funded and organic. As proud as I am to say that, I would love some debt right about now...lol. We can move forward with the sale and restrict US citizens and a few other jurisdictions from purchasing tokens until we have raised enough to file for Reg A+.  New Partnership Rumors: I'll tell you as much as I know. We pitched an offer to David Drake. Our offer was for him to take equity in our company and take on a more involved role as well as provide us with working capital. He's been a great advisor but we know of his resources and that he does not waste them on every ICO he advises. He has the experience, connections(and money) we need to take this project to the highest levels. We have passed his criteria checks of even being considered as a partner. We had a meeting with his investment manager and he advised David Drake to take equity in URAllowance and roll his sleeves up to get really involved. We have another meeting with both David and his manager. This could happen at any time. David called me two days ago for this meeting but I was driving and missed the call. If he says yes. We are set for an amazing launch. If he says no, we made it this far and we would not let a no from one person set us back or slow us down.  There it is. The pre-update on the big news. I will hopefully have more news very soon.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: You've got that right! Our ICObench and other rating sites scores are going up every day. Honestly, I don't see how these other projects are scoring 3's and 2.5's on their ranking and then staying there. I haven't come across one ICO ranker in which the score is final. I'd recommend that if you are holding an ICO and are not sure how you will perform on these ranking sites, list your company anyways. Make sure you have a comprehensive project and a team and whitepaper at least. You will learn your strengths and weaknesses from this. Don't get all bent out of shape like some do when receiving a low score. Use that info to better every part of your project. We are up to a 4.4/5 now at the Bench and my ISS (ICO Success Score) is not even reflected on there yet.  If you are an expert on the "people of blockchain" list, I would like to invite you to give us your honest, harshest, thorough ranking at ICObench. We have one expert rating and of course Benchy. (She Loved Us By The Way) Thank you in advance.  https://icobench.com/ico/urallowance

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I appreciate the support as usual. I have decided that I don't see them as competition or a threat. I have always said that "there is enough room on the blockchain for everyone and collaborative efforts should be explored before taking the competitive approach." As a search of my history here in this forum would prove, I have said that exact line many times when commenting on other projects. It would go against code to not adhere to the same practices. I have done a bit more research and have found that the person at the helm of this other project is very qualified to be in his position. They may be a little less blockchain smart than us but they have strengths where we could use some improving. I have reached out to the CEO and his team in every way I could find. I am sure I will hear back soon. Who knows? This could be a partnership opportunity that I missed by letting my feeling of having been insulted hinder my judgment. We will see. Side note: I am going to request that they stop calling themselves "the first family anything".

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I could only try to explain this complicated matter. But seeing as how our own government can not properly explain it, I don't think I will have much better luck. Mostly, this entire debate, no matter where it is taking place, is full of opinion and speculation. Not all tokens are securities. There are basic guidelines as to what makes a token a security.   The now Famous Howie Test is one such way to vaguely try and label a token a non-security. Another popular method I've been seeing for several months now..... I do not recommend this, by the way, I just find it rather hilarious..... Is when a company thinks that they can disguise their security token with clever verbiage and a list of "no-no" words that the staff and community managers must avoid at all costs. This route will come back to bite them in the ass later. lol.  We have a token that is consumable via our platform. We will also sell tokens from our platform after the ICO from our reserve pool that we have allocated exactly for this purpose. The price of our post ICO token will be $0.30, 10X more than the highest ICO price. This will make our reserve pool last much longer than if we sold them for $0.03. The reserve pool token sales is a necessary feature we have chosen to include to bring in all the parents and teachers that have no idea what an ICO or crypto is but really want to try our awesome platform because all the other parents, teachers and kids are using it.  Our in platform token sales, at first, will have to be USD purchased only. This is because if we allow for multiple cryptocurrencies this lands us in the exchange category. We wouldn't mind filing for whatever licensing we need to legally be able to exchange on our platform. For now, though, we have our hands full and must focus on development.  Luckily we are in talks with an exchange that is based out of Australia and they love our project and have offered to handle crypto:URA sales for us. More details to come on that.

Author: CHRISBIN702

Probably not my best leadership decision but I stand by it. Here is the clearest I can be though without pulling dates out of my a**. He introduced Bitcoin to several countries and invested in many crypto companies since back in 2011. Here's a recent panel he spoke on. He impressed me for sure.  https://drive.google.com/file/d/196uzZL1i-6RDutggD2gsUOLBpwc8zVAe/view  So this meeting is the first of several. Drake will advise on ICO strategy while Bill gets us prepared for investor relations and teaches us the best strategies while corresponding with the representatives from multimillion - and billion dollar investment funds. Author: viljy
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thank you, but I have already figured out my own. If schematically, then in your contract it will be like this: the parent includes the task, the child marks the task, the parent checks the performance, the child receives a reward. Do I get it right? Initially, I thought that the parent does not perform the task, but instead the contract will check the execution automatically. For example, assigning a child: to transfer some items to another place. When the child takes the last item, under it there will be a note with the password that he will enter into the contract, and this will be an automatic check of the task. The parent entered this password into the contract before the task. Or the child was given the task to do the cleaning. When cleaning, he will find a well-hidden password about the task, or he must find the parts of the password in different places of the room, so that until he does the cleaning, he will not be able to find all the parts. This is not only an automatic performance of the contract, but in some ways a game.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I really do appreciate you taking the time to look further into URAllowance. Yes, you have the basic idea now. There is another feature that we added in to keep the parents involved and see these things through to the end.Once a kid checks the task as complete, an automatic timer is initiated for the parents to approve the work of the kids.If the timer runs down to zero, the family-smart contract releases the funds to the kids wallet. And the same goes for the kids side too. No work no pay.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Wow! I was just reading all the posts here that I missed the last two days. To Everyone In This Thread Thank you all so much for the support. We knew we had a great idea. Personally, I was expecting a lot more naysayers. This is BTCT for crying out loud. Where are all my skeptics? lol. Seriously though, you have all been great and have been giving the team motivation to push through the long hours. We are building something great. It may seem simple at the base level, but I ensure you that mountains will be moved because of our efforts.  A few quick updates:  A week and a half ago I said that we were aiming for April 28th to begin our sale. I also said that was a wild guess that I came up with when I was filling out the forms for ICO calendar sites. They require that field have a date. I went with that date on all the forms I filled.  So.... I was wrong. We are ready as far as our Smart-Contract goes. We need to be a little bit farther along with development though. Also, being in licensed LLC in the USA has it's challenges as far as compliance goes. But not at all impossible though.  I have more updates but I gotta run right now. I'll be back in the next two hours to finish this update. No exact date yet. We have to do this right and not rush into anything.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Quote from: CHRISBIN702 on April 17, 2018, 03:25:49 PM Quote from: belechau on April 15, 2018, 06:39:50 PM I think I lost something. I was not even aware of the partnership with EventChain, it was a good project for me and it performed a good sale. How will this partnership bring benefits to URallowance? For them I'm sure it will be productive because URallowance has the potential to push them and give them more profits  Good question. I'm glad you asked. As of right now, Ashton is on tour traveling the world with EventChain and being the Keynote speaker at blockchain events. We hadn't ironed out the complete details yet but knew there was potential in partnership. Cross-promotional at first but getting into the development side I proposed that from our app and with URA, our users could purchase event tickets and also set up events for their schools, selling tickets for fundraisers. This is not set in stone and obviously, our devs would have to collaborate but the synergy is there and we are grateful have such a successful partnership that's been around for as long as he has.  Now for another update on this partnership. Nothing is set in stone but here is an offer I just proposed and another Use case for both projects. There is definitely relevance between our projects when you approach with an open mind. This is an excerpt from an email I sent to EventChain.  "Every Year PTA’s raise millions. 19.4 million last year with 6.4% yearly growth rate. These funds are shared with partners and third-party vendors that facilitate these fundraising events. The PTAs keep a small portion. http://fliphtml5.com/dtoi/mkdg (pg.39) Less than half of that is raised through ticketed events. Each individual PTA rep. has the ability to customize the way they raise money. After talking with a few local PTA board members, they agree that if it were easier to create events and distribute and sell the tickets, they would hold more concerts, plays and even sporting events would be easier to manage. How do we get in this tightly knit community??? Glad you asked. Below are the conversation and invitations to the once a year, National PTA Conference where all the top educational and PTA influencers and decision makers will be. They are starving for innovation. "  Now another email excerpt from the National PTA  "From: Amaia Stecker  Hello,  I'm reaching out regarding awareness and advertising opportunities with the National PTA at our onsite, print and digital platforms. Take a look, I think there are several opportunities for synergy between our organizations' goals.  2018 Convention and Exhibition, June 21-24 New Orleans: All the details about the Convention and Expo can be found here: www.pta.org/2018expo At the National PTA Convention, more than 1,000 influential PTA state and regional leaders and influencers, representing nearly 25,000 local chapters, will be looking for innovative products and services for their PTAs. PTA leaders want to implement well performing fundraising programs, improve school and PTA operations, enhance student well-being and discover great new resources - as well as find brands that have "feet on the ground" in communities nationwide and who can become a trusted ally and partner for their specific PTA. Our members are interested in what you offer and eager to share your information with others within their schools and communities. Just about everyone and everything in the family or school market can have success with the National PTA Convention: new technologies, learning resources, school supplies, fundraisers, purpose-led nonprofits, consumer packaged goods, "edutainers" and authors."   I would like to point out once more that EventChain has not yet agreed to this but I think it's a great way to get out there to the non-crypto world and spread some awareness and foster in some adoption for generations to come. What do you think?

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes, of course. We have posted screens and given the link to the mock-up. I will have them added to the OP here so you don't have to go through and search them out. We are starting out with a mobile platform because it will be easier to promote and market. Phase two: URWorld will also be on mobile but to experience the full glory of what it will be and also access all the monetization options of URWorld, A PC or Tablet computer will be necessary. Then, of course, our most ambitious goal, Phase 3 URWorld: Mixed Reality edition will only be available from your desktop and Hololens. This phase will be focused on education in Mixed Reality and will be a catalyst between the URAllowance platform's foundation of familial values and the expansion of our company into new unexplored territories of combining education with advanced technology. We are prepared for the future. Books, pens, paper. I love them. I grew up reading novels in a paperback and drawing until my arm was covered in pencil lead and ink. But our kids and their kids will not know these things the way that we do. They are born with this tech knowledge in their DNA already. So it only makes sense to take their education into the advanced realms of technology that they are comfortable with. Imagine I sent you back to school with a feather quill, an inkwell, and some scrolls. Or a chisel and some stone slabs. lol Sounds crazy. That is what we are asking our kids to do when we send them to school with a pen and paper. They've evolved beyond that being normal for them. So, to answer your question..... Yes, we will have an app. https://invis.io/N3GMUON57P6

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: It's official!!! David Drake is officially on our advisory board! Drake is a cryptocurrency man of steel ladies and gentleman. He has been in this game since before most of us were even using the internet on a daily basis.  David Drake LDJ Capital  David Drake is Founder and Chairman at LDJ Capital, a multi-family office which deals in worldwide funds accessing over $1.5 trillion in assets, and maintains over 50+ global directors and family office partners.   More recently, Mr. Drake is also seen as a leader in cryptocurrency.  Mr. Drake saw the value of digital assets when everyone was avoiding it.  It all started in 2011 when Mr. Drake collaborated on the JOBS Act to create new laws underlying all fundraising in the U.S. for all ICOs.  He runs a $200M LDJ Cayman Fund focused on cryptocurrency, mining and ICO acquisitions.  LDJ Capital Credit also offers middle market bridge financing to seed upcoming ICO’s.  Previously he held a majority stake as a Managing Partner with Robert Hambrecht in an Alternative Energy Fund NewCommons Capital 2009-2010.  David Drake is the Chairman of LDJ Capital, a multi-family office with holdings in Victoria Partners, a 500 family office network based in London; LDJ Real Estate Group; and The Soho Loft Media Group.   Mr. Drake has been involved in TMT (technology, media, telecoms), realty, hospitality, cleantech, energy and social impact investments for more than 20 years. He is an advocate of innovative investing in private equity, capital formation policies and developments globally, and the US JOBS Act which he lobbied for in the US Congress and the EU Commission. Because of his leading work in this space, he represented the US Commerce Department at the EU Commission in Brussels and Rome in 2012 and was invited to the White House Champions of Change ceremony in Washington, D.C. and as a speaker at the UK Parliament in 2013.  His investment, The Soho Loft Media Group, produces and sponsors over 200 global conferences annually and his articles are syndicated in over 100 publications.  One such event was April 2013 for the institutional media leader Thomson Reuters, with speakers from Nasdaq, NYSE, KKR and Carlyle Group. He advances financial innovation through his work as an international speaker and writer. He has spoken in top universities like Cambridge, NYU, Cornell, Columbia,  and writes regularly for major publications like WSJ, Forbes, Huffington Post, Thomson Reuters. He is the co-author of the books Planet Entrepreneur and is the author of the upcoming books The Crowdfunding Economy and LIFEE: Life Instructions for Entrepreneurs and Executives.  Previously, Mr. Drake has acted as general partner in fund-of-funds, realty funds, venture capital funds, seed funds and hedge funds.  Mr. Drake’s holdings have media partnership with the European Business Angel Network, European Venture Philanthropy Association and Angel Capital Association of North America.  He sits on 4 angel networks and has co-founded two angel networks.  Privately, Drake has hosted the Harvard Business Club of NY at his home, produced Carnegie Hall concerts and raised funds for the charities Trail Blazers and Best Buddies for many years. His years in the performing arts as a former board adviser to the Washington Ballet reached an apex March 2015 with a board director position at the New York City Opera  Born in Sweden and fluent in six languages, Mr. Drake has an MBA in Finance and an MA in International Law and Economics from George Washington University, where he was awarded the Wallenberg Scholarship for academic merit.  In my opinion, Mr. Drake is a beacon of success. He is the most well connected and motivated people I've ever met. He is truly on our board to help us succeed. I'd say we are lucky but actually, this partnership did not just land in our laps. My brother, Michael Martin saw David at the top of the "People of Blockchain" list along with several other influencers. We like to aim high. Out of all the top people on that list, Drake had, hands down, done the most for crypto on so many levels. I won't get into detail, but I will say that more than a few of the "top influencers" in the crypto space are selling their names and faces to anyone with enough ETH and is also willing to give up a large portion of their tokens. I am a little bit saddened by how many of these people that we are supposed to look to for guidance and unbiased opinion were willing to join our advisory board without knowing anything more than our names.     Some even responded to a simple introduction email with three page, pre-written sales pitch and contract. No thanks. We agreed from day one that we will not shill, be shilled, or support that crap  in any way, shape, or form. Needless to say, David stood out. When he replied to us I didn't believe it. Not only was he attentive, he was already making plans for us it seemed. I'm not saying that whole list over there at ICOB is bad. There are many, many reputable people of blockchain that are doing great things for crypto and giving their honest opinions on ICOs. The ones I'm talking about are high up the list but are few in comparisson. I won't name names but you know who you are. My advice, to the "shillers of blockchain", greed has toppled empires. You have enough money. Rediscover your crypto roots, the reason you became a pioneer. Be happy with what you've earned and stop selling yourselves to shit projects. Thanks Drake, for keeping real all these years and not succumbing to greed. I know why you are always smiling. Because you are content.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes. When we first conceived the idea for URAllowance we did extensive market research and also searched high and low for other similar projects. There was one that came out several years ago, PiggyCoin. They still trade on the market but the project has not moved forward in some time. They were a little bit too pre-school for our taste and for the market demand. Basically, we found a huge hole in crypto that was the same exact shape as URAllowance. The kids up to this point have been largely overlooked. Crazy to think of all the mass adoption talk you hear about every day but nobody was pushing crypto onto the obvious group that will bring mass adoption. Even the gaming ICOs have all been leaning towards the adult crowd. Except for GameFlip, they hit the nail on the head. After all the research into the markets and the scouring of consensus reports and survey data, we found a rather large untapped marketization opportunity. Allowances are just the start. 41 billion on average is paid out in allowances every year in America alone. Now it might seem a bit strange to bring a third party like URAllowance into an already decentralized transaction between parents and kids. Not to us though. We see the ineffectiveness in the current structure of allowances. We will fix it by getting the whole family involved and hold everyone accountable for their part. Aside from that, there is a trillion dollar speculative market that has recently opened up over the past 15 years. Women entering the higher paying workforce has left many household jobs needing to be filled. I have all the data cited in the whitepaper regarding this new market that is waiting for a few smart companies to come in and stake their claim. We will be one of them.
