Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: 1.Quick update. Our meeting with Dmitry Machikhin was postponed due to his crazy traveling schedule. He did tell me that taking on an advisory role would be tricky because he is working on Midex full time. He couldn't yet commit to that title. I fully respect that decision. Some ICO advisors that I see on twenty projects at one time makes me wonder if they are really advising or just selling their profile picture and name. He loves URAllowance and is an advocate for education on any level. Great guy all around. While I was researching him I discovered he is also humble. He never mentioned that he has fought and won some important battles for cryptocurrency against regulation. We are lucky to have gained his interest. If he can't give us proper advisory due to his busy schedule, he will take on an ambassador role for us. Whatever is decided, our team is happy to have him onboard. Our rescheduled appointment is set for April 16, 2018.  2. The alpha version of our platform is in development and we are putting the finishing touches on the new website early next week. Unless we find time this weekend. We may surprise you. The new website will look much cleaner and professional. Our CTO is a wizard and never ceases to surprise me. I did an alright job on the current website but as any visitor will be able to tell you, I'm not a pro web designer. So stay tuned for that.  3. Partnerships. We have a few important meetings this weekend with two local (Las Vegas) companies that are crypto veterans. I won't give up the names just yet. If next week rolls through and I haven't mentioned who they are then we didn't come to any terms.  4. Our Team/website/whitepaper/business plan/SWOT Security Audit is apparently sitting in the outbox of CryptoCoinConnect and the results are looking very good. According to them. I still wait to see it with my own eyes. I will post it here not more than one minute after we receive it.  5. Token Contract/Crowd Sale Contract. Complete. Since we are 100% self-funded and can't afford an outrageously priced celebrity to audit our Smart Contract, we are first having it audited internally. We have full confidence in its security. It was written by our CTO and none of it was outsourced. However, We understand the importance of external auditing so we will be starting a very generous bug bounty prior to deployment. If necessary.  That is it for today.  One more thing. We are willing to negotiate with some Seed Investors and or Venture Capital to help us out with some of these increasing Pre-Sale expenses. Everything would have to be done by the book though due to our geographical limitations. Thanks for reading.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thank you for noticing. However, the requirements have been set a little bit too high. Quality was definitely our goal here. We expected we would have a minimal amount of qualified signups with the current requirements. We were right. Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: If a member gets accepted into a higher paying sig campaign, we think that it would not be fair to penalize them wanting to earn more. Some campaigns are hard to get accepted into and when they have an opening they are often times open for a limited time. We know the forum's ins and outs. We are not just here to capitalize on the ICO trend. We were here long before this became popular and we will be here long after. I've never joined a sig campaign because I've always created and worn my own signature for affiliate marketing purposes. That doesn't mean that I haven't paid attention to them. The inability to leave has always been a turn off for me with most sig campaigns. So after discussing it with the team, we decided to allow our participants to leave whenever they want. I even have a hard time with locking participants into the translation bounties. That's not so bad though because no one is limited to one translation at a time.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Absolutely!!! Our kids are the future. The way we see it, mass adoption is not going to happen overnight. I'm not talking about mass acceptance. When I say mass adoption I mean crypto domination. Bold words I know. But think about it. The current lawmakers are stubborn and set in their ways. They grew up counting money with only 2 decimal places. What happens in twenty years when the lawmakers are replaced? Who are they replaced by? If we make cryptocurrency a part of our kids everyday lives, mass adoption becomes automatic. This is because crypto will be a comfortable form of currency that my son is familiar with. We have short-term goals of educating the next generation in financial responsibility. Our long-term goal, mass adoption, is simply a bi-product of what we are going to accomplish here.

Author: Rigorous
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I hate to ask hard questions for such a charming project, but this has been haunting me for a while: how will URAllowance solve the Oracle problem?  Or in plain English: how does URAllowance deal with the lack of discipline and cheating?

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I've never heard it called the Oracle problem before. The way we prevent lack of discipline, for parents and for kids, employers, and employees, is simple. After a task is complete and the kid or employee marks the task as complete on their dashboard. This action initiates a timer that begins to countdown on the dashboard of the parent or employer. This makes it so that the parent/employer must stay involved with the whole process all the way to the end. There is even an option to give bonuses at the time of verification for extraordinary work. If the verification timer runs down to zero, the reward is transferred to the wallet of the kid/employee. No complaining from either side because the smart contract has rules and if they are not followed then the smart contract does what it was programmed to do without emotion.

Author: Rigorous
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Introducing a timer to the smart contract condition is quite a clever invention.  My worry stems from the opposite: that parents are too lenient, resulting in rewards for jobs done half-assed or not at all, effectively spoiling the kid.  If the timer running out results in a reward it is too easy for the parent to become lazy. No complaints from the kids either. Therefore I would suggest the timer running out to result in no reward or a partial one, so that both the parents and the kids have to keep interacting with the contract.

Author: lvsca
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: great idea. i like how you think.

Author: levyashin
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I think with URAllowance, parents still need to act with responsibility. If their actions cause their children to spoil, URAllowance can't prevent it. It is just a tool for parents and children can interact with smart contracts. It is a good way to discipline but it can't do everything alone. Parents need to be responsible.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Hmmmm.  Very good point. Definitely something to consider. Our timer design was based on the assumption that parents won't want to give allowance away for nothing. But the laziness of parents is an issue for sure. We have an option for a family news letter to go out weekly or monthly to the entire family. Grandparents, aunts, uncles, brothers, pastures, coaches, anyone that is considered close to the family can get one. It will include important dates and events. Perhaps on the front, we will include statistics of the parents and the kids. How many times the timer made it to zero and how many times the task was incomplete. This could motivate them all parties to follow through. If their loved ones are watching. Thank you, for the insight.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: When we are kids We think our parents are gods. No one is more responsible, no one is stronger, no one is scarier, no one makes you feel safer. As a parent, I realize, that is not the truth. Parents, myself included, can be lazy, irresponsible, selfish and ignorant. I try but it proves to be increasingly difficult as time goes on. A tool that forces any level of accountability would be a welcomed part of my routine.

Author: lobat999
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: This project is beginning to have healthy discussions among its followers and I'm getting more interested in this as I have 2 kids which I'm excited to test the platform's features as a use case.

Author: Rigorous
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: If you think about it, parenting has concepts that also exists in economy and politics - just scaled down to a family level.  The Oracle problem I talked about before is something you will experience with URAllowance, id est: how do you translate a real life event into an accurate digital input for the smart contract? For example, when the job is to clean up their room, how do you make sure a dirty room does not result in a green check mark? In this case, the parents are the Oracles. Can they be trusted with themselves? The same goes with logistics projects on the blockchain. How do you make sure a package is indeed correctly delivered in order to signal it was a success to the smart contract? In that case, is the deliverer a trustworthy Oracle, or is there a possibility the deliverer fails to deliver the package while telling the smart contract it was received?  This becomes a lot easier when signals do not have to cross the border between the digital and analog world. For example, a job could consist of a math exam. The solution can be verified by a trustworthy Oracle, a calculator, and sent directly to the smart contract without any human intervention. In fact the calculator can be designed in such a trustworthy way, having no dependency on a centralized, possibly untruthful Oracle, one could say it is a trustless system, because no trust is required for the correctness of the system, other than the trust in the system as a whole.  That last bit may surprise you. Yes, even a trustless system requires a base level of trust. You could go as deep as not trusting 1 + 1 = 2.

Author: Michelle24
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Very interesting discussion. Yes the problem is really the interface between the real world and the digital. The trust in my case is not the problem, because my child is trusting me to 100%.

Author: levyashin
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I get your point about Oracles but if you think about that, Oracles are parents in this program and if they give a duty to their children, it is logical that they will decide whether is it enough or not. Even if you do a ai that can check the jobs and give red or green mark to it, if a parent is irresponsible enough can say "hey don't be sorry here is 200$ for you to spend on pc game, don't tell your mother"  The ultimate thing is parents need to be responsible. If they are not, URAllowance is not a magician. Just a tool for parents to help themselves.

Author: Rigorous
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: That is exactly what I was getting at. The parents are the Oracles.  The modern use of the word oracle has sometimes become bastardized, meaning a good source of information.  In the classical sense oracles were not infallible at all, in fact, the priests deliberately misled people to influence politics, as the oracle's prophecies were understood to be the will of the gods verbatim - yet gibberish under the influence of chemical fumes, and the priests could interpret that gibberish as they pleased.  It is the classical sense of the word oracle, not the modern bastardization, I believe to be the correct meaning in the context of the Oracle problem. It is about the trustworthiness of the conduit, or like Michelle24 said, the interface, between the input and the output.  Bear with me. If you have ever watched an episode of Cesar Millan's Dog Whisperer you may notice he is not so much training the dog as he is teaching the handler. In most cases the handler is the source of the trouble, not the dog. Similarly URAllowance should be teaching the parents, not just their kids.

Author: cantdecide
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Well in case of a parents child relationship both have to trust each other or there have to be put in specific rules for for example how a cleaned up room has to look like. For example no toys on the floor, not just put into the closet but sorted or what ever. I think in this case there will be some solutions.

Author: levyashin
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Yes but the problem is there is a paradox. If parents think they need to be educated they will educate themselves about this and it wouldn't be an issue for them. The problem is the parents which need education and think they don't need one. This group is something you can't help with an app like this. Being a responsible parent can't be forced. They do or they don't. It is out of URAllowance's area.

Author: lobat999
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: I would like to think of it this way, that URAllowance is a project that will further the relationship between parents and kids and will eventually lead to a more harmonious relationship between them.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: That's what we are here for. The reason this forum exists is that a very important project was being developed and the creators needed a place to discuss its progress. Thank you for being here and I'm always glad to hear when someone is actually interested in using the URAllowance platform for its intended purpose. This isn't a token that you need to lock away and hoard like a crazy cat lady would her pizza box pizza protectors and soy sauce and towers of junk mail. We encourage that you use the URA for teaching your kids about finance and responsibility. From an economic standpoint, money needs liquidity. It needs to move around. It needs to grow. Us old school crypto nuts are hardwired to hold but I personally have never been a holder. I use cryptocurrency as a currency and I am teaching my son about it as a currency too. Please be sure to report here your experiences when the platform becomes available.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: These are some of the most constructive criticisms I've heard yet. It seems then that "trustless" is a term that is being tossed around rather loosely in the crypto world. Any time humans are involved in the verification process of any event, trust is reintroduced to the equation. Aside from having A.I. controlled surveillance systems connected to smart contracts, the best possible solution I can come up with right here on the spot is... Incentivised honesty and penalized laziness. You have got me thinking. I appreciate your comments. Please stick around. I'm sure as others read this conversation, more ideas and solutions will begin presenting themselves. Thank you, sir.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Bingo!! Absolutely correct. That is a huge piece of the URAllowance solution. We are in fact providing the tool that parents use to teach themselves how to teach their kids. As URAllowance matures as a platform, it will also become wiser. The URRules Forum will fill up with useful advice from parents that have been through the process and as time goes on, we all become better and more aware. I can't think of another platform that unites families in such a timeless manner while simultaneously creating real-world economic value and providing education that is also ageless.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Nope. Not difficult at all. Teaching Crypto to an adult has proven to be difficult. Kids have an open mind. Furthermore, kids of today are genetically coded to better understand technology and can grasp these topics almost instantly. If you watch the CryptoKid videos we've been posting you will be surprised to hear that the first four videos that CryptoKid recorded were done from information he absorbed just listening to his mom and I and people in our network talking to each other.  I was amazed at how much he knew before I even started teaching him. The videos "All about airdrops" and "Blockchain" were recorded in two takes from his memory. Meaning he didn't practice it or have a script. It's basically him just talking about crypto and it is informative too.  The only hard part about teaching a kid any subject is the competition for their attention. Make it exciting and offer rewards they can see and use and that task is a little easier.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Thanks for coming around. The Family-Smart Contract is only the base layer of our project. The implementation of URAllowance and FSCs into homes, schools, Non-profits, community centers, and the workplace will be helped along by our very solid plan and planned partnerships with many non-profit organizations that are known for their involvement in schools, families, and the community. The partnerships with organizations like Boys and Girls Club, Boy Scouts of America, YMCA, PBS Kids, D.A.R.E. and Girl Scouts, and the National PTA all cost money. They are non-profits which means that their whole operation is funded by grants and donations from "partners" that must undergo deep evaluation before they will even consider taking a prospective partners money. We have started the process with all the organizations I just listed above at some level.Some I already have the forms for and others I am waiting to hear a response. We will start finalizing these after the ICO when we have the funds to entertain their respective offers. URAllowance is positioned at the epicenter of a few never before monetized or blockchain industries. The future for URAllowance is looking very good.  By the way, if anyone here is having any doubts about our project please post them here or in our telegram. We will gladly answer any questions you have. Thank you all for being here. The ride was a little bumpy at first but everything is falling into place perfectly.

Author: CHRISBIN702
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: That is a good question. The info in the OP may need to be adjusted. We have not included a soft cap in the coding of the smart contract but it can be added in before our smart-contract is deployed and audited. Once deployed though, it will not be altered one bit. We have planned the development of URAllowance in three phases. Phase 1:, The Web APP and the base layer of which the other two are built on vertically. The first phase is nearing an alpha release and that would be what our softcap was based on. The other two phases will be funded either from the main round of the ICO or from revenue URAlllowance will be bringing in from the Premium memberships. Obviously the former would be preferred over the latter because it would be faster. So to answer your question, the project is already being realized. Reaching our hardcap will accelerate us to our mixed reality goals much faster.

Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: Funny you should say that. We are heavily marketing the parents:kids side of URAllowance currently. But, as you said, Our platform will be usable in other areas as well. One that we often talk about here at the office is "Per-Diem". For those of you not familiar with the term, per-diem means "per day" and is an allowance given to employees for every day that they have been traveling for work. It's common in the construction industry. Also, the Family-Smart Contract and the app (We finally see an alpha tomorrow) is just the foundation on which many levels of URAllowance is built and will tier upwards in features, price, monetization opportunities, and technological innovation. Author: lvsca
Title: ✍️ ☑️ ✐ [ANN][ICO]URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract | ✐ ☑️ ✍️
Body: URAllowance - Family-Smart Contract (FSC)  FACEBOOK | TWITTER | YOUTUBE | TELEGRAM| WEBSITE  Check Out Our White Paper     INTRODUCTION  Join the evolution of family. URAllowance is the number 1 family based cryptocurrency platform designed to enhance the family system. URAllowance empowers each family with their very own set of Family Smart Contracts, bringing the family closer together and providing the tools to teach kids the importance being financially educated.  By getting the FAMILY involved we will bring back Old School responsibilities, instilling an Old School sense of PRIDE for what ONE has EARNED OUR BOUNTY IS LIVE CLICK HERE  HOW IT WORKS? ROAD MAP 1. Concept Q4 2017: Think tank begins. Research and timeline creation.  2. Formation Q1 2018: Form the company URAllowance and obtain LLC status. Recruit advisors. Pre-Ann thread at the forum. Form the core team members.  3. Preparation Q1-Q2 2018: Design website. Structure the URA token. Design alpha UX/UI. Introduce the idea to local schools. Airdrop. Gather feedback. Bounty campaign.  4. Pre ICO 6/30/2018 - 9/30/2018 Q2-Q3 2018: Deliver UX/UI to developers. Launch smart contract. Deploy token.  5. ICO Q3-Q4 2018: Release the alpha of URAllowance platform. Immediately begin research and development of URWorld in which all the features of the alpha platform will be available in a 3D virtual, social, customizable world.   6 ICO Q3-Q4 2018 Analyze Marketing data and adjust marketing campaign accordingly. Analyze data and user suggestions from alpha URAllowance platform and prepare for the public release at the end of the ICO.   7. Post ICO Q4 2018 - Q1 2019: Release URWorld beta version. Gather reports and suggestions from the community. URWorld public release in Q3 2019. Restructure marketing campaign from token sale marketing to product marketing for maximum exposure and adoption. Integrate with the LIX P2P platform digital asset sales and creation.  8. URWorld: Mixed Reality Edition Q4 2018-Q2 2019: Begin development of URWorld: Mixed Reality Edition in which all the features of the URAllowance Platform and the URWorld 3D virtual experience will be accessible in Mixed Reality. Begin the Microsoft Hololens Integration.  9. Microsoft Hololens Partnership Q4 2018-Q2019: Answer Microsoft's call to action for educational Hololens software. Mixed reality software will be in the highest demand by Q4 2018.   10. Beyond- Continue to improve all three versions of the URAllowance experience. Relocate the URAllowance HQ and expand the support staff. Begin the URA holders think tank for deciding which new frontier to journey to. The possibilities are limited only by our imaginations. We welcome everyone along for the ride. Notice: Mandatory Ping Pong for All employees  Prototype Screens(The styling used and images displayed are stock images and placeholders.) https://invis.io/N3GMUON57P6#/290414298_Cover  Token.Detail Token.Allocation Name.:.URAllowance Symbol :.URA Decimal :.18 Total Supply :.1,000,000,000.URA Blockchain :.Ethereum Reissuable :.No Burnable :.No Preminted :.Yes Hard Cap :.30,000 ETH.(~$18m) Presale : 15% ICO : 35% Team & Advisors : 18.6% Airdrop/Bounties : 5.4%% Reserved In-App Sales : 25% Community : 1% ICO Stage :.2 Length : 6 Weeks Total Token For Sale :.405,000,000.URA Rate : 0.0000740740740 ETH Presale Bonus :.30% Supply :.150,000,000.URA.(45M.are.Bonus) ICO Supply :350,000,000.URA  URAllowance has partnered with Mitosis Technology for the development of the first phase of the URAllowance platform        MEET    P.S : All new important news will be update in this thread  NEW UPDATE

Quote from: CHRISBIN702 on February 20, 2018, 01:27:44 AM Quote from: levyashin on February 19, 2018, 12:51:35 PM Quote from: CHRISBIN702 on February 19, 2018, 12:18:32 PM Quick update. We are making our rounds around the world with our reps presenting and pitching us at different venues across the globe. John McAfee gave us a door or at the blockchain conference in Dallas this week. Michel Louie introduced URAllowance to many big names of the crypto world at Anarchapulco this weekend. March 31 it's a blockchain and charity event in St. Petersburg sponsored by bankex, ICOBench and Eberhard Lindfordt. Misha Trubkin will be presenting us there. Lots more to come, including the official Ann Thread.  Actually, i don't like McAfee (probably he wants that most people don't like him) but having him in a very early stage has very good perks.  Joining a conference and a charity event which sponsored by big guns is very important also i like your project from day one, it can make parents life way easier.  By the way, when will pre-ico happen? And will you open a whitelisting?  These are good questions. I will start by saying when dealing with eccentric rich guys, I think they are largely disliked and most prefer it that way. Probably some kind of defense mechanism to protect their money. You don't have to like someone or even agree with their values or personal life decisions to be useful to each other on a business level.  The charity event will be great. It will also be televised and recorded in English. http://digitalexperts.tv/blago.html there is the link. you'll find us in the program on the first page.  The pre-ico, for those that have been following, has been changed from having a starting date to TBA status. This is good in a way because if we would have launched unprepared, it would have killed our company before it started. I know we made the right choice in postponing because I've been busy working 18 hours every day and the team is just as productive. We are laying the foundation for URAllowance to be built on and we are forming the right partnerships at every turn.  Note: If there is anyone that can't wait to be involved in the URAllowance project. Anyone that sees we are destined for success. We have opened a private pre-sale with very special conditions. You can fill out the contact form on the website www.URAllowance.com or you can contact me directly.  Thank You. For private pre-sale inquiries: FSC@URAllowance.com or call or text my personal number below. (a text is your best option, I will respond within 1 hour)  Chris Butler President and Co-Founder URAllowance, LLC +1 702-758-4209 Quote from: levyashin on February 19, 2018, 12:51:35 PM Quote from: CHRISBIN702 on February 19, 2018, 12:18:32 PM Quick update. This is an exciting concept ensuring the future of the crypto world by creating a blockchain that directs its footprints. I wish you all the best in this novel concept alphabetized right from a meaningful and captivating title.  Wow, thank you for the kind words. I read them before but as I was scanning back through the first page I saw them again and wanted to say thanks. So far the general consensus from multiple communities, crypto, and non-crypto, is optimistic with a very excited overtone. We welcome all feedback and/or criticism. For those of you first seeing this thread, we have been conducting every part of our ICO under the watchful eye of the public. We don't like keywords and clickbait, it's just our rebellious nature, but here are a few unavoidable KYs for you. This document is a work in progress and over the course of our business development many changes will be made. Parts of this document will be removed and parts will be added. In the spirit of blockchain and transparency, we have been writing our whitepaper In a live document under the welcomed scrutiny of the community. To avoid any confusion that this method will undoubtedly cause, we have Included a version history of all changes made to this document starting from the completion of the very first draft. Yes. I copied that from our whitepaper. That's ok because I wrote them and I'm in a hurry. I have to get back to helping our team create something amazing.
